text: Maria Piechotka (12 July 1920 – 28 November 2020) was a Polish politician and architect. She was a member of the Sejm from 1961 to 1965, representing the Warsaw district of Wola. She was a liaison officer during the Warsaw Uprising. Piechotka was born in Kraków, Poland. Piechotka died on 28 November 2020 in Warsaw at the age of 100. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Polish architects Category:Politicians from Kraków Category:Politicians from Warsaw Category:Polish centenarians
title: Maria Piechotka
